title: fix: Make create flow button to have a consistent style with rest of the theme
Reddit auth timeout
body:
Installed v0.15.0 now that the Reddit auth token is properly refreshed (thanks!)

Two things:
- I have a Reddit-triggered-based flow that should be executing a Reddit query every 15 minutes, although looking under "Executions", it appears to only be running every hour
- Most of the Executions have errors out with "getaddrinfo EAI_AGAIN oauth.reddit.com" as the error message, suggesting some sort of timeout when trying to connect to Reddit's authentication system. One execution did work (the one at the 12 hour mark after creating the app -- not sure if the length of time is relevant), so it's not completely broken.

Let me know if I need to provide any additional information, thanks for the great project!

body:
Bumps [@node-saml/passport-saml](https://github.com/node-saml/passport-saml) from 4.0.4 to 5.1.0.
Release notes

Sourced from @​node-saml/passport-saml's releases.

🔗 Dependencies

  • Revert release-it for Node@18 compatibility #962
  • Update minor dependencies #961

📚 Documentation

  • Update Sponsor information - Stytch #960

⚙️ Technical Tasks

  • Lint #954

v5.0.1

  • Lint (113412a)

  • Remove unused AuthorizeOptions type (#887) (f574901)
  • Clarify SLO support in passport-saml (#862) (0e34bc8)

  • Clean up types (#813) (930082a)

title: docs: Remove early stage warning from docs
Release/v0.15.0
feat: Implement GitHub release CI flow
test: add form tests
No new Docker release in 9 months despite recent commits
body:
Hi team,

I've been looking into Automatisch as a potential self-hosted alternative to Zapier. I've noticed that while the GitHub repository has had recent commits, there hasn't been a new release published to Docker Hub (`automatischio/automatisch`) in about nine months.

This makes it difficult to use the latest features and fixes. Is there a reason for the delay, or a new release planned soon?

Thanks for all your work on this project!

body:

Release notes

Sourced from multer's releases.

v2.0.2

Important

  • Fix CVE-2025-7338 (GHSA-fjgf-rc76-4x9p)

Full Changelog: https://github.com/expressjs/multer/compare/v2.0.1...v2.0.2

v2.0.1

Important

  • Fix CVE-2025-48997 (GHSA-g5hg-p3ph-g8qg)

Registry hosted install
body:
Hello. I'm hoping you all will consider posting your compiled image to a container registry as part of a release workflow. 

You cannot build when using swarm services. This would spare me a deviation in upgrade path from all my other services. 

Although I have no clue how to do it, I feel this would be an easy and logical step for the project to absorb. 

Thank you for any consideration

Ref: https://www.reddit.com/r/docker/s/qJkvPLamVa

title: Security Vulnerability Report - Hardcoded Credentials
body:
Hello maintainers,

  I hope this message finds you well. I was reviewing your codebase and
  discovered a security issue that I'd like to bring to your attention
  through responsible disclosure.

  Issue Summary:
  I found hardcoded credentials in your test files that could pose a
  security risk. The affected file contains:
  - Hardcoded passwords in plain text
  - Potentially unsafe token extraction methods

  Affected File:
  packages/e2e-tests/tests/flow-folders/flow-folder.spec.js (around line
  196-205)

  Impact:
  While this is in test code, hardcoded credentials can:
  - Be accidentally used in production environments
  - Expose sensitive information in version control
  - Create security vulnerabilities if test credentials are reused

  Proposed Solution:
  I have prepared a fix that:
  - Replaces hardcoded passwords with environment variables
  - Implements secure token extraction with proper validation
  - Maintains all existing functionality while improving security

  Next Steps:
  I'm happy to help resolve this issue. I can:
  1. Submit a pull request with the fix (if you'd like)
  2. Provide the specific code changes via email
  3. Discuss the issue privately if you prefer

  I'm committed to responsible disclosure and will not share details
  publicly until you've had time to address this.

  Thank you for maintaining this project. Please let me know how you'd like
   to proceed.

  Best regards,
Steph MeshCode

feat(telegram-bot): add parse mode option for message formatting
body:
## Description

This PR introduces a new **parse mode option** for the Telegram bot integration, enabling more flexible message formatting when sending messages through the bot. With this enhancement, users can now easily specify the desired parse mode (such as `Markdown`, `MarkdownV2`, or `HTML`) to control how Telegram renders the message content.

## Motivation & Context

Previously, messages sent via the Telegram bot did not provide an option to set the parse mode, limiting formatting capabilities. This update addresses that limitation, allowing for richer, more expressive messages and supporting a wider range of Telegram features.

## Changes

- Added a `parse_mode` option in the Telegram bot action configuration.
- Updated the Telegram action logic to include the `parse_mode` parameter when sending messages via the Telegram API.
- Documented the available parse modes (`Markdown`, `MarkdownV2`, `HTML`) in the action configuration UI/help.

## Screenshots / Demo

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ad37365f-de5e-4fd3-9295-ae1090e04e57)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9d868446-c68c-461c-b1c3-6bd8230afa2a)


## Checklist

- [x] Added new `parse_mode` option to Telegram bot configuration
- [x] Updated message sending logic to use the selected parse mode

## Related Issues

https://github.com/automatisch/automatisch/issues/2561

---

Let me know if any further adjustments or clarifications are needed!

Fix: Unsafe Regular Expression Pattern Could Slow Down Application in packages/backend/src/apps/formatter/actions/text/transformers/replace.js
body:
**Context and Purpose:**

This PR automatically remediates a security vulnerability:
- **Description:** RegExp() called with a `$` function argument, this might allow an attacker to cause a Regular Expression Denial-of-Service (ReDoS) within your application as RegExP blocks the main thread. For this reason, it is recommended to use hardcoded regexes instead. If your regex is run on user-controlled input, consider performing input validation or use a regex checking/sanitization library such as https://www.npmjs.com/package/recheck to verify that the regex does not appear vulnerable to ReDoS.
- **Rule ID:** javascript.lang.security.audit.detect-non-literal-regexp.detect-non-literal-regexp
- **Severity:** MEDIUM
- **File:** packages/backend/src/apps/formatter/actions/text/transformers/replace.js
- **Lines Affected:** 16 - 16

This change is necessary to protect the application from potential security risks associated with this vulnerability.

**Solution Implemented:**

The automated remediation process has applied the necessary changes to the affected code in `packages/backend/src/apps/formatter/actions/text/transformers/replace.js` to resolve the identified issue.

Please review the changes to ensure they are correct and integrate as expected.

Please review the changes to ensure they are correct and integrate as expected.

title: Fix: Redis Service Allows Unauthorized Privilege Escalation in .devcontainer/docker-compose.yml
body:
**Context and Purpose:**

This PR automatically remediates a security vulnerability:
- **Description:** Service 'postgres' allows for privilege escalation via setuid or setgid binaries. Add 'no-new-privileges:true' in 'security_opt' to prevent this.
- **Rule ID:** yaml.docker-compose.security.no-new-privileges.no-new-privileges
- **Severity:** HIGH
- **File:** .devcontainer/docker-compose.yml
- **Lines Affected:** 11 - 11

This change is necessary to protect the application from potential security risks associated with this vulnerability.

**Solution Implemented:**

The automated remediation process has applied the necessary changes to the affected code in `.devcontainer/docker-compose.yml` to resolve the identified issue.

Please review the changes to ensure they are correct and integrate as expected.

here is the content of the docker stack (docker compose):

```
services:
  redis:
    image: redis:7
    container_name: automatisch-redis
    hostname: automatisch-redis
    security_opt:
      - no-new-privileges:true
    read_only: false
    volumes:
      - /mnt/docker_data/automatisch/redis:/data:rw
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "redis-cli ping || exit 1"]
    environment:
      TZ: America/New_York
    restart: on-failure:5

  db:
    image: postgres:17
    container_name: automatisch-db
    hostname: automatisch-db
    security_opt:
      - no-new-privileges:true
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "pg_isready", "-q", "-d", "automatisch", "-U", "automatisch"]
      timeout: 45s
      interval: 10s
      retries: 10
    volumes:
      - /mnt/docker_data/automatisch/db:/var/lib/postgresql/data:rw
    environment:
      POSTGRES_DB: automatisch
      POSTGRES_USER: automatisch
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: redacted
    restart: on-failure:5

  main:
    image: automatischio/automatisch:latest
    container_name: automatisch
    hostname: automatisch
    security_opt:
      - no-new-privileges=true
    healthcheck:
      test: wget --no-verbose --tries=1 --spider http://localhost:3005/ || exit 1
    ports:
      - 3005:3005
    volumes:
      - /mnt/docker_data/automatisch/storage:/automatisch/storage:rw
    environment:
      PORT: 3005
      APP_ENV: production
      REDIS_HOST: automatisch-redis
      POSTGRES_HOST: automatisch-db
      POSTGRES_DATABASE: automatisch
      POSTGRES_USERNAME: automatisch
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: redacted
      ENCRYPTION_KEY: my9bfhzxuojhVlrWs4redacted
      WEBHOOK_SECRET_KEY: fS7b0CZa33pt0XVredacted
      APP_SECRET_KEY: hL2LPvKBGMadtsu4redacted
    restart: on-failure:5
    depends_on:
      db:
        condition: service_healthy
      redis:
        condition: service_healthy

  worker:
    image: automatischio/automatisch:latest
    container_name: automatisch-worker
    hostname: automatisch-worker
    security_opt:
      - no-new-privileges=true
    volumes:
      - /mnt/docker_data/automatisch/storage:/automatisch/storage:rw
    environment:
      WORKER: true
      APP_ENV: production
      REDIS_HOST: automatisch-redis
      POSTGRES_HOST: automatisch-db
      POSTGRES_DATABASE: automatisch
      POSTGRES_USERNAME: automatisch
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: redacted
      ENCRYPTION_KEY: my9bfhzxuojhVlrWs4redacted
      WEBHOOK_SECRET_KEY: fS7b0CZa33pt0XVredacted
      APP_SECRET_KEY: hL2LPvKBGMadtsu4redacted
    restart: on-failure:5
    depends_on:
      main:
        condition: service_started
```

title: Fix Google Authetication missing refresh token
body:
This change should fix https://github.com/automatisch/automatisch/issues/1579 issue.

## How to reproduce the bug
1. Authenticate for any Google product (eg. Google Sheets)
2. Go to **"My Apps"** -> **"Google Sheets"**
3. Select **"Connections"** tab
4. Delete the connection
5. Re-authenticate for the same product again with the same account.

After 60 minutes  run your automation. Your `access_token` will expire and refresh token request will return error:
```
{
  "error": "invalid_grant"
  "error_description": "Bad Request"
}
```

I've described why this happening in my reply to the issue here: https://github.com/automatisch/automatisch/issues/1579#issuecomment-2993675456

## Screenshots
This will demonstrate visually how Google OAuth returns responses based on the `prompt` value.

### `select_account`

On this image you can see, that response does not contain `refresh_token` value. Because `select_account` returns `refresh_token` ONLY on first request. Every subsequent requests will come without refresh token.

![no_refresh_token](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/db65c85d-e1d4-4430-a635-28b44b4796d8)

### `select_account+consent`

On this image you can see, that `refresh_token` is present on every response.

![with_refresh_token](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/44eb20f4-5e16-4d5c-9ae3-955fbbb15d48)

P.S. you can see `refresh_token_expires_in` value, because my Google OAuth App is in test mode.

title: fix: User Deletion and User Creation Improvised #2218
Issue 1: Inconsistent Configuration Loading in `knexfile.js`
body: The `knexfile.js` appears twice in the provided files. The first instance loads configurations from `./src/config/app.js`, whereas the second loads them from environment variables using `process.env`. This inconsistency can lead to different configurations being used depending on which `knexfile.js` is active, potentially causing unexpected behavior in different environments (development vs. production/testing).

title: Fix: Inconsistent naming for `computeAuthStepVariables`
Fix: Inconsistent use of `process.env`
Issue 1: Inconsistent use of `import` and `require`
body:
<Body>
The codebase uses both `import` and `require` for importing modules. While both can work in Node.js, it's best to be consistent throughout the project. Since the majority of the files use `import`, it would be ideal to refactor `license-server-with-mock.js` and any other files using `require` to use `import` syntax to maintain consistency.

```diff
--- a/license-server-with-mock.js
+++ b/license-server-with-mock.js
-const fs = require('node:fs');
-const https = require('node:https');
-const path = require('node:path');
-const { run, send } = require('micro');
+import fs from 'node:fs';
+import https from 'node:https';
+import path from 'node:path';
+import { run, send } from 'micro';
```

title: A couple of grammar fixes
• Send tweets including Automatisch to general Slack channel PUBLISH Trigger 1. Twitter +
Issue 1: Redundant `fileExtension` definition in `knexfile.js`
body:
Body:

The `knexfile.js` appears twice in the file list. Both files define the `fileExtension` variable with the same value. This repetition can lead to inconsistencies if the value needs to be changed in the future, as it would require updating it in multiple places. Ideally, the configuration should reside in one place and be imported into other `knexfile.js` configurations.
